location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘Correspondence with the Canadian Government on the subject of the peace settlement with Turkey.’

physicalDescription.extent: The correspondence is arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the first folio with 1, and terminates at the last folio with 6, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: Copies of correspondence exchanged between the Secretary of State for the Colonies and the Governor-General of Canada, on the subject of the Peace Settlement with Turkey, commonly referred to as the Treaty of Lausanne. The correspondence covers the period 27 October 1922 to 24 March 1924. The file was published by HM Stationery Office, London, 1924.

name.namePart: Secretary of State for the Colonies, United Kingdom
